sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: Returns the TCP/IP hostname of the machine whose numeric address is specified by the hostAddr parameter.
sections.text_content: Returns the TCP/IP hostname of the machine whose numeric address is specified by the hostAddr parameter.
sections.mdown_content: Returns** **the TCP/IP hostname of the machine whose numeric address is specified by the *hostAddr* parameter.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The Net module requires a TCP/IP stack to be installed and operating in order to function. It does not communicate using any other protocols

It is possible for Firewalls to interfere with the actions of the Net module, preventing connections from taking place.
sections.text_content:
The Net module requires a TCP/IP stack to be installed and operating in order to function. It does not communicate using any other protocols
It is possible for Firewalls to interfere with the actions of the Net module, preventing connections from taking place.
sections.mdown_content:
The **Net** module requires a TCP/IP stack to be installed and operating in order to function. It does not communicate using any other protocols
It is possible for Firewalls to interfere with the actions of the **Net** module, preventing connections from taking place.

sections.title: Example
code:
var hostAddr : string := "128.100.5.1"
        put "The machine name of ", hostAddr, " is ", 
            Net.HostNameFromAddress (hostAddr)
sections.raw_content: The following program prints out the hostname of the machine whose TCP/IP numeric address is "128.100.5.1".
sections.text_content: The following program prints out the hostname of the machine whose TCP/IP numeric address is "128.100.5.1".
sections.mdown_content: The following program prints out the hostname of the machine whose TCP/IP numeric address is "128.100.5.1".

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Net.HostNameFromAddress, not by calling LocalName.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling Net.HostNameFromAddress, not by calling LocalName.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling **Net.HostNameFromAddress**, not by calling **LocalName**.
